page.title: 02COMMENT ON AUCHTERTOOL
page.content: The village of Auchtertool has been described "as a place everyone passes through and nobody stops". This must have been true at the end of 19th century when the American Ornithologist Alexander Wilson visited the parish and wrote a poem about his experience. My March I pursued, Till I came to a hill top, where joyfully I viewed. Surrounded by mountains and many a white pool. The small working village of old Auchtertool. An inn I inquired out and lodging desired. But the landlady's pertness seemed instantly fired . For she saucy replied as she sat carding wool.
